1.rationale:
Let’s analyze our situation:

• Our head is at (5,7). Our body occupies the cells going left: (4,7), (3,7), (2,7), (1,7).  
• The enemy snake’s head is at (3,8) and its body spans (4,8) to (8,8), so moving UP to any y=8 cell is unsafe.  
• Moving LEFT would send us into our own body at (4,7), so that’s not an option.  

That leaves us with DOWN (to (5,6)) or RIGHT (to (6,7)).  
• Moving RIGHT lands us at (6,7) and gives us a Manhattan distance to the (7,3) apple of |7–6| + |3–7| = 1 + 4 = 5 steps away.  
• Moving DOWN sends us to (5,6) and the same apple becomes |7–5| + |3–6| = 2 + 3 = 5 steps away.  

Looking at the other apples, note that the ones on the left (at (2,2) and (1,1)) would be slightly closer if we head down and then steer left, since from (5,6) the distance to (2,2) is |2–5| + |2–6| = 3 + 4 = 7, while from (6,7) to (2,2) it is 4 + 5 = 9.  

Thus, moving DOWN keeps us safe and nudges us toward a potential route toward the cluster of apples in the bottom left. Additionally, we avoid the enemy snake’s territory on row 8.

Next move: DOWN.

1.rationale:
Currently, our snake’s head sits at (5,6) and we have three immediate safe options: moving DOWN to (5,5), LEFT to (4,6), or RIGHT to (6,6). Let’s analyze them:

• Moving DOWN to (5,5) reduces our vertical position. From (5,5) the apple at (7,3) is |7–5| + |3–5| = 2 + 2 = 4 steps away, while the cluster of left-side apples (at (2,2) and (1,1)) is |5–2| + |5–2| = 3 + 3 = 6 steps from there.  
• Moving RIGHT to (6,6) brings us toward (7,3) as well, where the distance would be |7–6| + |3–6| = 1 + 3 = 4. However, if we go right, we might later have fewer options when trying to pivot toward the bottom left apple cluster.  
• Moving LEFT to (4,6) would bring us closer towards the left-hand apples (distance to (2,2) would be |4–2| + |6–2| = 2 + 4 = 6), but that move makes the (7,3) apple less accessible, as it increases the steps to that target.

Given our earlier rationale that a DOWN move keeps us safe and positions us advantageously for either apple cluster—and noticing that from (5,5) we’re only 4 steps away from the tasty (7,3) apple—continuing with our previous tactic seems wise.

As our snake’s head progresses along the DOWN direction for now, we can later decide to orient our movement toward (7,3) by stepping RIGHT, or begin a course for the left-side cluster if needed. For this turn, the safest and most versatile move is to continue DOWN.

Decided next move: DOWN.
